page.title: 13SOCIAL ACTIVITIES-BLEWBURY
page.content: THERE ARE FOUR PUBLIC HOUSES OR INNS IN BLEWBURY.THEY ARE"THE RED LION,THE BARLEY MOW,THE BLUEBERRY INN AND THE LOAD OF MISCHIEF" THE RED LION IS ONE OF THE OLDER PUBLIC HOUSES BUT THERE IS NOTHING TO TELL WHEN IT BECAME ONE.THE BUILDING WAS E ERECTED IN 1612.A SMALL INSCRIPTION ON THE WALL AT THE FRONT SAYS:W.B.NOV. 24TH 1807.IT IS SAID THAT WILLIAM BOHAM SPENT MUCH TIME THERE PLAYING SKITTLES. KENNETH GRAHAME,THE WRITER,IS KNOWN TO HAVE FREQUENTED THE RED LION. THE BLUEBERRY INN,LONDON ROAD:IS ABOUT 155 YEARS OLD AND WAS BUILT IN 1830.IT WAS NAMED "THE KING WILLIAM IV",BUT WITHIN TEN YEARS WAS KNOWN AS THE NEW INN.IN THE LAST CENTURY THE PUBLICAN RAN ALSO A CARTER'S BUSINESS.THE STABLES AND COACHING FACILITIES USED TO WHERE THE CAR PARK IS TODAY.
